TopicTitle: [1.12.X] Tantares - Stockalike Soyuz and MIR [16.1][28.05.2024][{Proton Revamp]

EDIT: I just realized the station has a typo in its name

This is officially one of the dankest ISS replicas I've yet to see. Incredible.

I'll be traveling a bit today, but while I'm in the air, I should have time to complete the ATV solar panels. Finally have them figured.
Any word on new .craft files?

What mod has the big solar panels?

So, I learned a lot about how solar panels work in KSP...

Here they are actually working. Only thing left to do on them is stats, a little texture polish, and an animation speed tweak so they retract nicer. If anyone is interested in how to do this, I can describe the process, newb-to-newb.

Any word on new .craft files?

It'll be after the next Tantares update, that's for sure.

wow I have not been on in a while. (Oh look the gemini changed I'm gonna have to update hermes again without anything extra done cause I'm lazy >.>)

Quick questions as I try not to hate stock early game career and get back into things is the vostok service module supposed to be purely structural, or did I glitch something overloading on mods? I could have sworn there were plans to make it do something... >.> also are all the tantares pods supposed to have built in SAS? its felt like so long its hard to tell what's intentional, what's a typo and and what's another mod's doing <.<

Does anyone have trouble reentering the atmo with the Vostok capsule? It seems like no matter what the reentry profile is (i've tried sooo many trajectories) i cant slow down below ~200 m/s. This is coming from an 80 km orbit.

Nice work on the ATV panels! Very nice!!! (read with Borat voice)

What mod has the big solar panels?

Looks like KOS to me

What mod has the big solar panels?
Looks like KOS to me

It's the KOSMOS mod, with the solar panels resized by me a bit in scale to match the ISS solar array dimensions, also my texture is custom for them, I can share it if you want

It's the KOSMOS mod, with the solar panels resized by me a bit in scale to match the ISS solar array dimensions, also my texture is custom for them, I can share it if you want

Yes please!! Also if you can, more details, like those struts linking Destiny with the S0 truss, P1 and S1 materials, any soldering (Ubio) and some more details.

Thanks in advance!!
Does anyone have a remotetech2 cfg for the tiny little loop antenna? Thanks

Yes please!! Also if you can, more details, like those struts linking Destiny with the S0 truss, P1 and S1 materials, any soldering (Ubio) and some more details.

Thanks in advance!!

Okay so here's the dirt:

any soldering (Ubio)?

Yes, LOTS. Each individual module that you can see attached by a docking port is basically ~parts. Each section is pretty much whatever the thing is (so all of Zarya is 1 part) and it's docking ports (so 3 more parts) and any animated parts like solar panels or radiators (so 2 more parts). So the whole Zarya section is 6 parts. This is how my station is at about 120 parts right now (127 with the Cygnus I just docked). If anyone wants a tutorial on how to part weld send me a PM and I can show you! It's really quite easy

like those struts linking Destiny with the S0 truss

Ahhh yes the magic of Kerbal Inventory System and Kerbal Attachment System! The struts are from KAS and custom rescaled by me into another part that is 2x as large and strong and heavy for a bulkier look.

P1 and S1 materials

These ones sucked, but were the first truss segments I made without a skeleton to build around as I crafted my own (using references from other parts and pictures) Basically, I did this:

- Build half hexagon shape out of pipes from the Infernal Robotics Rework (remodel?) mod and then attach a center "truss structure" using the in game trusses

- According to reference photos I repeated this half hexagon up every 1.75m or so (i thnk)

- Build the up and down pipes to connect every corner

- Lastly, I covered up the "walls" with a bunch of wings from the Aero tab and started sticking on different greeebles and effects for aesthetics and realism.

and some more details

All in all, very fun to build, very laggy to put together XD but the hardest and longest part (lol male genitalia joke goes here) is the building everything before I weld it all!

Total time distribution:

- VAB part making = 60%

- Welding parts together = 8%

- Building rockets and launching said parts = 10%

- Docking = 2%

- Waiting for ksp frEAKING LOAD EVERY TIME I NEED TO MAKE ONE LITTLE CHANGE TO A CONFIG FILE BUT DON'T WANNA JACK EVERYTHING UP FROM A "RELOAD ALL" IN SPACE CENTER = 20%

And for the solar panels:

I'm still waiting to hear from cardboardboxprocessor as to whether or not I can post a public link to my textures, but if he doesn't reply i'll post it and hope for the best XD in the meantime Drakenex check your messages

Big Soyuz!

Zvedza Zarya spacecraft/Big Soyuz? It was a giant Soyuz reentry module.

"Big Soyuz" as in... like the same concept as "Big Gemini"?
I think big Soyuz was a concept for an armed spacecraft. It was supposed to be a descent module that appears to be three times bigger than Soyuz, with a machine gun in place of the OM/docking port

Some specs of the Big Soyuz "Big Tantares"

The crew size will be four kerbals, obviously twice of that of the original Tantares.

And the descent module's size is 1.25m at the top, and 2.5m at the bottom, and the propulsion module is 2.5m at the top and 3.75m at the bottom. If you guys want, i could scale it down.

I'm still thinking about the IVA, there's no pictures of the interior of the Big Soyuz, so i'll be going by Zarya's interior. How about a split section IVA?

For example:

Heh... I barely speak a lick of Russian, but the pictures are nice.

Btw, the reentry module itself is the same - 2m form factor, 2 seats (not scaled up).

Orbital module (below the reentry one) has 3 m diamater Ã¢â‚¬â€ the same as MOL or the small diameter of TKS.

Two seats in the reentry were placed not side-by-side (as in common Soyuz), but 69 - as in old Dark Star movie.

Between there was an additional hatch in the reentry's floor and heatshield Ã¢â‚¬â€ also as in MOL and TKS.
